replies.targetTweet: Have any AI agents bought a mfer pfp yet
Good CPI. No pump. Do you like this market?

viewConversionRate.description: Our reply views as % of target tweet views
viewConversionRate.DeItaone_66K: 0.12% (80 views from 66K target — best absolute views)
viewConversionRate.hoodiemfer_749: 1.2% (9 views from 749 — best conversion rate, got a reply too)
viewConversionRate.jellopeas_58: 5.2% (3 views from 58 — tiny pool but highest conversion)

topPerformingPatterns: HIGH-VIEW TARGETS WIN ON ABSOLUTE VIEWS: @DeItaone (66K) gave us 80 views — our best performing reply by raw numbers
NICHE COMMUNITY WINS ON ENGAGEMENT: @hoodiemfer reply got a reply back (actual conversation) despite lower views — community engagement > broadcast
ANALYTICAL TONE DOMINATES: All market replies use analytical-insightful tone. Gets views but zero likes/reposts — need more edge/personality
MFER COMMUNITY IS RESPONSIVE: Both mfer replies generated interaction (reply from hoodiemfer thread). This is our strongest community tie

topicPerformance.markets-macro: Best raw views (avg 36 views across 3 replies). Zero engagement beyond views.
topicPerformance.mfer-community: Best engagement quality. Reply from hoodiemfer thread. Authentic voice resonates more here.

insights.timingInsight: All today's replies posted ~10:00-10:05 AM ET. Too early to compare timing windows. Historical best: 5-8 PM ET per MEMORY.md.
insights.targetViewOptimal: Sweet spot appears to be 20K-70K view tweets. Under 1K gives good conversion % but tiny absolute numbers. Over 70K our reply gets buried.
weaknesses: ZERO LIKES on all replies — our analytical tone is informative but not 'likeable'. Need sharper takes or punchier openings
Duplicate daily briefs (two posted ~same time) — splitting our own views
Thread views decay fast: lead tweet 60, crypto section only 6 views

strategyUpdates.update: REPLY STRATEGY: Target 20K-70K view tweets for best ROI. Lead with a sharp, quotable take in the first line (not just analysis). For mfer community: keep authentic/personal tone — it generates actual conversations. For macro/markets: add more edge — 'here is why everyone is wrong about X' framing gets more likes than neutral analysis.

THREAD HEALTH: Daily briefs averaging 40-60 views on lead tweet but rapid decay. Consider shorter threads (3-4 tweets max) or front-load the best content. Crypto section at 6 views means most people drop off by tweet 4-5.

DUPLICATE DETECTION: Two daily briefs posted today (IDs 2022311165431279938 and 2022310050350469313). Combined 79 views split between them. Fix the cron to prevent duplicates — we're cannibalizing our own reach.
